title: Florida Says It Plans to End All Vaccine Mandates
summary: The state would be the first to scrap requirements that children be vaccinated to attend school, among other rules.

title: Snubbing RFK Jr., States Announce Plans to Coordinate on Vaccines
summary: Governors in California, Oregon and Washington said their states would work together on vaccine guidance in a time of turmoil at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

title: Trump Advisers Have Discussed a Job for Adams if He Quits Mayor’s Race
summary: The conversations have also involved Curtis Sliwa with the goal of giving Andrew Cuomo a better chance of defeating Zohran Mamdani in November.

title: As Zohran Mamdani’s Stature Grows, He Tries to Shed Some Past Stances
summary: Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic nominee for mayor of New York City, once called for defunding the police and decriminalizing prostitution. He says he has changed.

title: Trump Team Urges G.O.P. to Rebrand Signature Policy Law
summary: Top campaign officials told House Republicans they should rebrand the measure the president dubbed the “One Big Beautiful Bill,” in a nod to its unpopularity with voters.

title: Putin Takes His ‘Limo Diplomacy’ to China
summary: Rides in his hulking bulletproof Aurus with the Indian and North Korean leaders offered the Russian leader an ideal setting for deepening ties.

title: Xi Parades Military Strength as Trump Accuses Him of Conspiring With Putin and Kim
summary: The parade, attended by the leaders of Russia and North Korea, had a defiant message. President Trump fired back, accusing Xi Jinping of ignoring America’s role in World War II.

title: White House Orders Agencies to Escalate Fight Against Offshore Wind
summary: The effort involves several agencies that typically have little to do with wind power, including the Health and Human Services Department.

title: The Communist Warrior Stranded for Decades in an ‘American Colony’
summary: Ahn Hak-sop was captured during the Korean War by the South and imprisoned for more than 40 years. Now 95, he wants to return to the North to die.

title: Hegseth Says Boat Strike Is Start of Campaign Against Venezuelan Cartels
summary: The defense secretary and President Trump said a small boat was carrying drugs but offered little evidence and few details.

title: Venezuela, Drug Boats and Trump’s Latest Claim: What to Know
summary: The Trump administration says Venezuela is sending vast amounts of cocaine to the United States. Venezuela’s role in the drug trade is overstated, experts say.

title: Claudia Sheinbaum Walks a Political Tightrope as Rubio Visits Mexico
summary: U.S. pressure to crack down on corrupt politicians has squeezed President Claudia Sheinbaum of Mexico ahead of her meeting with Secretary of State Marco Rubio.

title: The Met Opera Turns to Saudi Arabia to Help Solve Its Financial Woes
summary: The Met, which has withdrawn $120 million from its endowment since the pandemic, reached a lucrative deal to perform in Saudi Arabia for three weeks each winter.

title: Google Must Share Search Data With Rivals, Judge Rules in Antitrust Case
summary: Judge Amit P. Mehta said the company must hand over some of its search data to rivals, but did not force other big changes the U.S. wanted.

title: Did Google Just Get Spared? Investors Think So.
summary: The nuclear option for addressing the tech giant’s search dominance — a break-up — is off the table. That’s lifting Big Tech stocks.

title: Dan Kleban Joins Maine Democratic Primary, Seeking to Unseat Senator Susan Collins
summary: Dan Kleban enters a crowded Democratic primary as party leaders wait for Maine’s Democratic governor, Janet Mills, who is “seriously considering” a run for Senate.

title: John E. Sununu Is Exploring a Senate Run in New Hampshire
summary: The former senator has been out of office for more than 15 years, but his last name is synonymous with Republican politics in a state where party leaders see a chance to flip a seat.

title: This Is the Moment We Find Out if Trump Is for Real
summary: What comes next?

title: How to Rethink A.I.
summary: Building bigger A.I. isn’t leading to better A.I.

title: A Protest in China Doubles as Performance Art
summary: We explore an act of defiance in China. But first, a look at President Trump’s health.

title: N.Y. Attorney General Sues Far-Right Group VDARE for Misusing Funds
summary: The suit says the nonprofit’s leaders — who helped bring anti-immigrant ideas into the G.O.P. mainstream — used donor money to buy a castle-like home.

title: What We Saw at a Job Fair for ICE
summary: As ICE ramps up for more deportations under President Trump, Nicholas Nehamas, a Washington correspondent for The New York Times, talks with applicants at an ICE recruitment fair in Texas.

title: Far-right Israeli Minister Calls for West Bank Annexation
summary: Bezalel Smotrich said Israel should take over most of the territory, partly in response to growing international moves to recognize a Palestinian state.

title: Federal Courts Slow to Fix Vulnerable System After Repeated Hacking
summary: After a 2020 breach thought to be Russia’s work, the courts told Congress that they would harden a system storing sealed documents. Five years later, the system was hacked again.
